results.title: The Traditional world of Islam: nomad and city
results.brief_description: The nomads and the city dwellers - these are the two roles of Islamic civilization, and it is the tension existing between the two which has given to it an inner energy and capacity for self-renewal.
results.title_for_label: The Traditional world of Islam: nomad and city

results.title: Traditional world of Islam: man and nature
results.brief_description: Nature is regarded in the Islamic world as the “cosmic text”, the counterpart of the Koran itself, to be respected and enjoyed and not feared, conquered or exploited.

results.title: The Traditional world of Islam: the inner life
results.creator_credit: Stephen Cross, Paul Keeler and Stephen Cross Ltd
results.brief_description: Explores the inner life, the mystical path within Islam known as Sufism and the role it has played with the civilization. This film is part of a series which examines various aspects of Islamic civilization. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Two towns: Gubbio in Italy, Chillicothe in Ohio
results.creator_credit: John H. Secondari, Helen Jean Secondari and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparative cultures and geography”
Explains that the towns of Gubbio in Italy and Chillicothe in southeastern Ohio are both agricultural centres of about 30,000 people. Describes the different value systems based on historical, cultural and geographical factors. Shows scenes of daily routines.
results.title_for_label: Two towns: Gubbio in Italy, Chillicothe in Ohio

results.title: Two farms: Wisconsin, Hungary
results.creator_credit: Richard Kuhne, John H. Secondari, Helen Jean Secondari and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparative cultures and geography”
Contrasts farm life in Wisconsin and southeastern Hungary following one family in each rural area through a daily routine. Features members of the families commenting on how their farms operate and what they find satisfying in their lives.

results.title: How long is a minute?
results.brief_description: Divides the screen into five separate images to show visually a precise minute, without any reference to clocks or seconds. Reveals what can be done in less time and what takes longer.

results.title: Wonders in your own backyard. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: This film is designed to stimulate close and early observation. It shows a group of children finding a snail, grasshopper, earthworm, sowbug, spider, caterpillar and inchworm in their backyard. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: The Superlative horse
results.creator_credit: Urs Furrer, Yanna Brandt and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Based on the Chinese traditional tale about a ruler, Duke Mu, who loved horses. When the position of chief groom for the royal stables must be filled, he sets the young aspirant for the job, Han Kan, the task of finding a “superlative horse” as a test of his ability to judge good horses. An allegory tale based on the book of the same title by Jean Merrill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Urs Furrer, Yanna Brandt and Phoenix Films
